Super September Events in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach
By
Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau
on
Sep. 03, 2025
Welcome to September in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, from
your Events Authority!
We're happy to present a rundown of fun things to do in Punta Gorda, Port Charlotte, and Englewood, Florida this September.
The best local events this month include an elegant and spooky cocktail event, a spotlight on various local restaurants, a world-class art exhibition, and more!
Read on to
start planning your next adventure
and
find even more to do here:
Events Calendar
Special Events
Labor Day Weekend:
There's usually a big to-do over the Labor Day weekend. In 2025, the
Battle of the Bands & Food Truck Throwdown
at the Charlotte County Fairgrounds held center stage, so keep this holiday on your radar for next year!
Englewood Beach Waterfest Pirate Poker Run
September 5 and 6, 2025
Head to
Ken & Barb’s Grove City Kitchen
to get in on the
Pirate Poker Run
fun and be sure to come back for
Englewood Beach Waterfest
on October 10 and 11!
Let’s Eat! Englewood Restaurant Week
September 11–25, 2025
The annual
Englewood Restaurant Week
is the perfect time to expand your culinary horizons. With set prices for both 2-course lunches and 3-course dinners at a variety of local restaurants, you’ll want to try them all!
Origami in the Garden
September 13, 2025–April 30, 2026
Peace River Botanical & Sculpture Gardens
is proud to present
Origami in the Garden
, a unique and internationally celebrated exhibition exploring the ancient art of paper folding as translated into large-scale metal sculpture. You’ve never seen anything like it, so don’t miss your chance to experience it in person.
ReptiDay Port Charlotte
September 13, 2025
Reptile appreciators rejoice, the family-oriented
ReptiDay
is back with plenty of opportunities to learn about “outside-the-pet-store” animals. You may even find a new family pet from among the hundreds of reptiles, amphibians, invertebrates, arachnids, and small exotics in attendance.
Folk & Flutter Butterfly Festival at Peace River Gardens
September 13, 2025
Head over to The Gardens to
celebrate all things butterfly
! Featuring live music, cold drinks, great food, vendors, and more!
Key Lime & Tropical Fest
September 20, 2025
Head over to
Fishermen’s Village
to celebrate
all things Key Lime
while enjoying live music, vendors, and activities for kids of all ages.
Punta Gorda September Sullivan Street Craft Festival
September 20 and 21, 2025
Downtown Punta Gorda will be abuzz with artistic energy for the
September Sullivan Street Craft Festival
. Shop the creative works of artisans from across the country and to explore
Punta Gorda’s thriving independent restaurant scene
while you’re at it!
Edgar Allen Poe Speakeasy - Chapter Two
September 25–27, 2025
The last time the
Speakeasy
opened in Port Charlotte, it was a rousing success, so they're back for a chilling chapter two! This is a 4-part cocktail experience centered on the haunting tales of Poe, and it's like nothing you've ever experienced.
Weekly Events
The
Punta Gorda Downtown Farmer’s Market
, Saturdays, 8 am–1 pm, offers a wide variety of ready-to-eat and ready-to-cook food, souvenirs, art, plants, and much more.
The
Punta Gorda History Park Market
, Sundays, 9 am–1 pm, features some produce but the focus is on art, antiques, original food products, pet accessories and treats, etc.
The weekly
Wine & Craft Beer Tastings
by
Punta Gorda Chocolate & Wine
is the perfect place to explore new vintages and brews, and maybe find your new favorite!
Live Entertainment
The
Parrot Magazine
is the go-to source for local live music in the area.
Visani Italian Steakhouse and Comedy Theater
presents musical tribute shows and live stand-up by nationally recognized comedians.
We hope to see you around in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach for an awesome August and a spectacular September!
Share
Categories:
Events
Author
Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau
A visit to Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast is a peaceful gateway to Southwest Florida. As Florida’s premier ecotourism destination, you’ll find us to be free of crowds and off the beaten path yet still offer the comfort and amenities discerning travelers seek. Situated on Charlotte Harbor with endless miles of natural shoreline, we are home to unlimited outdoor pursuits like beaches, world-class sailing, boating, fishing, paddling, birding, dining and arts. Come find out why “Our Best Side is Outside
sm
”.

Great Fall Events and Activities in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach
By
Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau
on
Aug. 30, 2024
Fall is a great time to travel, and Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is the perfect destination for exciting fall events and activities worth traveling for. Here are a few to get you started:
Let's Eat, Englewood
One of our signature Fall events is the annual
Let’s Eat, Englewood Restaurant Week
, which usually runs the last two weeks of September.
Participating restaurants offer set-price three-course dinners and two-course lunches. It's a scrumptious way to have culinary adventures without breaking the bank.
Fall Fishing
Trolling the waters of the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast this time of year can reward you with anything from barracuda and Spanish mackerel to amberjack, king fish, and snapper. Find out more about what you might catch in the fall with our
Fishing Forecast
.
'Tis the Season
Even though it's often warm enough for shorts and flip flops around here, even as we get close to "winter," there are still plenty of
cheery activities
going on in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach. We've also compiled a handy list of
New Year's Events
.
Several restaurants are open for Thanksgiving and
Christmas days
, and someoffer holiday Buffets. Visit our
Restaurant page
to find tasty food and drink to enhance your fall travel. See you soon!
Share

While Away the Winter: Events and Festivities in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach
By
Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau
on
Nov. 29, 2024
Doing fun Christmas activities in shorts and sandals is an easy way to make your friends and family back home jealous! Not to brag, but that’s our normal in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach. While you may need a sweater at night, the days will likely have you running around free as a bird in tank tops and flip flops.
We’d like to share a few of our charming holiday happenings to inspire a visit when you need a break from the cold and snow—it's never too early to start planning!
Lights and Displays
During the holidays, homeowners along the canals of Punta Gorda go all-out decorating the backs of their homes, even some docks and boats, and their de-“light”-ful creations are only visible from the deck of a boat...which is where Christmas Lights tours come in.
Boat Cruises
Enjoy festive lights aboard the area's original tiki boat! Christmas Light Canal Cruises with Cruisin' Tikis Charlotte Harbor launch from the dock near TT's Tiki Bar. Choose from either public or private tours on this cozy and fun vessel.
Christmas Lights Canal Cruises
with King Fisher Fleet depart from the elaborately-decorated Fishermen’s Village three times a night for the entire month of December.
Christmas Canal Tours with Punta Gorda Adventures depart twice a night from Laishley Park Marina. They also run tours the whole month of December and offer festive goodies and holiday music.
We Love a Parade
The annual downtown Punta Gorda Christmas Parade happens mid-December, with the fun starting at noon. This welcoming community event helps set the tone for a friendly festive season.
The annual
Punta Gorda Boat Parade
is viewable from various spot along the route in Punta Gorda Isles.
They always provide a map of the route
with information on where to see the boats.
Peace River Botanical & Sculpture Gardens
We look forward to
Gardens Aglow at Peace River Botanical & Sculpture
Gardens
every year. The gardens come alive after dark with thousands of lights and decorations. Santa has been known to attend, and evens usually include carol singing and S’mores roasting by the fire.
Fishermen's Village
Fishermen’s Village
is festooned with over a million Christmas and holiday lights and decorations every year, and the display is a destination in its own right. They typically turn on the display the Saturday before Thanksgiving with their
Lighting of the Village
event, then the
Festival of Lights
will illuminate the entire Village for the rest of the year. Alongside the holiday fun, this is always a must visit to window shop and buy gifts, have a great meal, take an amazing boat tour, watch an beautiful sunset, dance to live music, and people watch.
Wonderland of Lights
Head over to the Charlotte County Fairgrounds any December evening to enjoy the magical throw-back experience of an enchanting Christmas light drive with the
Wonderland of Lights
! The fairgrounds are festooned with fun and beautiful displays sure to enchant kids and grownups alike.
Enjoy this purely Florida holiday video to get you in the spirit, then read on to start planning!
Holiday Happenings
Creative events pop up everywhere over the holidays, courtesy our great local businesses. You'll find Christmas, Holiday, and Ugly Sweater parties at spots like
Charlie Foxtrot Brewing
,
Downtown Kava
, the
Nav-A-Gator Grill
, and others!
Enchanted Holiday Circus
The Enchanted Holiday Circus at the Charlotte County Fairgrounds features circus performers, Santa's Village, music, and more!
Show Time!
Charlotte Players
The
Charlotte Players
can always be counted on to put on a funny, sometimes bawdy, and always touching holiday show!
The Symphonic Winds of Charlotte County
Each year, the Symphonic Winds of Charlotte County present a holiday concert. In 2024, they presented both secular and sacred holiday music in a variety of arrangements, from traditional to new, with The Gift of Music at The Charlotte Performing Arts Center.
Visani Italian Steakhouse & Comedy Theater
You never want to miss the Elvis Christmas Show at
Visani Italian Steakhouse and Comedy Theater
! One of the top Elvis Tribute Artists in the world, Dwight Icenhower, embodies The King in this special holiday show that will warm your heart.
Mindi Abair Returns
One of Punta Gorda's favorite people, master saxophonist Mindi Abair, usually presents a Christmas show, like 2024's
I Can't Wait For Christmas Tour
.
The Florida Philharmonic
The Florida Philharmonic always presents a holiday-themed concert like 2024's Home for the Holidays.
The Charlotte Chorale
The Charlotte Chorale
's annual concert, like 2024's
Sing We Now of Christmas
, takes place at the Charlotte Performing Arts Center and is always the perfect way to get into the spirit of the season!
The Gulf Theater at the Military Heritage Museum
The Gulf Theater
at the Military Heritage Museum presents a variety of Christmas shows, like a 1940s Radio Christmas Carole, a Three Tenors Christmas, and Christmas-themed Barbra Streisand and Rat Pack tribute shows.
Once you’ve experienced “winter” in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, you’ll realize it’s definitely worth a “do over” – every year!
There's also plenty of incentive to stay through the New Year: explore
Things to Do for New Year's Eve
.
